senses.sense_definition: An abbreviation for <w>Victory in Europe</w>, referring to the end of World War II in the European theater.

examples.text: The whole country celebrated wildly on <w>VE</w> Day.
Historians often discuss the political climate just before <w>VE</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A non-standard spelling of the word <w>we</w>, used to represent a foreign accent, often German.

examples.text: <w>Ve</w> have ways of making people talk in this town.
The captain said that <w>ve</w> must leave the ship immediately.

senses.sense_definition: A gender-neutral personal pronoun used as a subject, equivalent to singular they.

examples.text: <w>Ve</w> decided to walk to the park alone.
I asked ver if <w>ve</w> wanted to join us for dinner.

senses.sense_definition: The name of the Cyrillic letter Ð’.

examples.text: The Russian word begins with the letter <w>ve</w>.
He practiced writing a cursive <w>ve</w> in his notebook.
